qas.question: King Philip renounced his right to the throne after what treaty?
Which country did Britain acquire Newfoundland and Acadia from?
Which country did Britain acquire Gibraltar and Minorca from?
Which colony allowed Britain to control the Atlantic entry and exit point to the Mediterranean?

answers.text: permission to sell slaves in Spanish America

qas.question: What was the Spanish term for permission to sell slaves in Spanish America?

context: At the concluding <a0_0>Treaty of Utrecht<a0_0/>, Philip renounced his and his descendants' right to the French throne and Spain lost its empire in Europe. The British Empire was territorially enlarged: from <a1_0>France<a1_0/>, Britain gained Newfoundland and Acadia, and from <a2_0>Spain<a2_0/>, Gibraltar and Minorca. Gibraltar became a critical naval base and allowed Britain to control the Atlantic entry and exit point to the Mediterranean. Spain also ceded the rights to the lucrative <a4_0>asiento<a4_0/> (<a3_0>permission to sell slaves in Spanish America<a3_0/>) to Britain.
